ThingDef.label: Heavy Carapace Helmet
ThingDef.description: An improvement in the previous design of Carapace Helmets though never popularly adopted due to the Fall of the Great Domain. Providing great protection without becoming cumbersome, the Heavy Carapace Helmet is now stronger and more durable without sacrificing comfort for protection. This was achieved through advancements in plasteel plating, providing greater protection without adding too much weight. Though lacking the larger stores of its lighter brethren, the Heavy Carapace Helmet has become more popular with heavy infantry and shocktrooper regiments throughout the Rim.

li.loreDesc: An improvement in the previous design of Carapace Helmets though never popularly adopted due to the Fall of the Great Domain. Providing great protection without becoming cumbersome, the Heavy Carapace Helmet is now stronger and more durable without sacrificing comfort for protection. This was achieved through advancements in plasteel plating, providing greater protection without adding too much weight. Though lacking the larger stores of its lighter brethren, the Heavy Carapace Helmet has become more popular with heavy infantry and shocktrooper regiments throughout the Rim.
li.vanillaDesc: A reinforced carapace helmet built to pair with heavy carapace armor. Extra plating provides greater protection at a cost of adding additional weight while remaining resource efficient. The additional protection still does not provide the same level of protection as a full helmet does.

ThingDef.label: Heavy Carapace Helmet (Medic)
ThingDef.description: An improvement in the previous design of Carapace Helmets though never popularly adopted due to the Fall of the Great Domain. Providing great protection without becoming cumbersome, the Heavy Carapace Helmet is now stronger and more durable without sacrificing comfort for protection. This was achieved through advancements in plasteel plating, providing greater protection without adding too much weight. Though lacking the larger stores of its lighter brethren, the Heavy Carapace Helmet has become more popular with heavy infantry and shocktrooper regiments throughout the Rim.\n\nThis variant is marked for usage by Medical staff.

li.loreDesc: An improvement in the previous design of Carapace Helmets though never popularly adopted due to the Fall of the Great Domain. Providing great protection without becoming cumbersome, the Heavy Carapace Helmet is now stronger and more durable without sacrificing comfort for protection. This was achieved through advancements in plasteel plating, providing greater protection without adding too much weight. Though lacking the larger stores of its lighter brethren, the Heavy Carapace Helmet has become more popular with heavy infantry and shocktrooper regiments throughout the Rim.\n\nThis variant is marked for usage by Medical staff.
li.vanillaDesc: A reinforced carapace helmet built to pair with heavy carapace armor. Extra plating provides greater protection at a cost of adding additional weight while remaining resource-efficient. Identical to the standard heavy carapace helmet, but marked with insignia to denote medical personnel.

ThingDef.label: Heavy Carapace Helmet (Engineer)

Providing great protection without becoming cumbersome, the Heavy Carapace Helmet is now stronger and more durable without sacrificing comfort for protection. Though lacking the larger stores of its lighter brethren, the Heavy Carapace Helmet has become more popular with heavy infantry and shocktrooper regiments throughout the Rim.\n\nThis variant is marked for usage by Engineering staff.

Providing great protection without becoming cumbersome, the Heavy Carapace Helmet is now stronger and more durable without sacrificing comfort for protection. This was achieved through advancements in plasteel plating, providing greater protection without adding too much weight. Though lacking the larger stores of its lighter brethren, the Heavy Carapace Helmet has become more popular with heavy infantry and shocktrooper regiments throughout the Rim.\n\nThis variant is marked for usage by Engineering staff.
li.vanillaDesc: A reinforced carapace helmet built to pair with heavy carapace armor. Extra plating provides greater protection at a cost of adding additional weight while remaining resource-efficient. Identical to the standard heavy carapace helmet, but marked with insignia to denote engineers.

ThingDef.label: Heavy Carapace Helmet (Thermal)
ThingDef.description: An improvement in the previous design of Carapace Helmets though never popularly adopted due to the Fall of the Great Domain. Providing great protection without becoming cumbersome, the Heavy Carapace Helmet is now stronger and more durable without sacrificing comfort for protection. This was achieved through advancements in plasteel plating, providing greater protection without adding too much weight. Though lacking the larger stores of its lighter brethren, the Heavy Carapace Helmet has become more popular with heavy infantry and shocktrooper regiments throughout the Rim.\n\nThis variant is modified for usage on extreme cold worlds.

li.loreDesc: An improvement in the previous design of Carapace Helmets though never popularly adopted due to the Fall of the Great Domain. Providing great protection without becoming cumbersome, the Heavy Carapace Helmet is now stronger and more durable without sacrificing comfort for protection. This was achieved through advancements in plasteel plating, providing greater protection without adding too much weight. Though lacking the larger stores of its lighter brethren, the Heavy Carapace Helmet has become more popular with heavy infantry and shocktrooper regiments throughout the Rim.\n\nThis variant is modified for usage on extreme cold worlds.
li.vanillaDesc: A reinforced carapace helmet built to pair with heavy carapace armor. Extra plating provides greater protection at a cost of adding additional weight while remaining resource-efficient. Lined with thermal material to protect the wearer in extreme temperatures.

ThingDef.label: Heavy Carapace Helmet (Officer)
ThingDef.description: An improvement in the previous design of Carapace Helmets though never popularly adopted due to the Fall of the Great Domain. Providing great protection without becoming cumbersome, the Heavy Carapace Helmet is now stronger and more durable without sacrificing comfort for protection. This was achieved through advancements in plasteel plating, providing greater protection without adding too much weight. Though lacking the larger stores of its lighter brethren, the Heavy Carapace Helmet has become more popular with heavy infantry and shocktrooper regiments throughout the Rim.\n\nThis variant is marked for usage by Officers.

li.loreDesc: An improvement in the previous design of Carapace Helmets though never popularly adopted due to the Fall of the Great Domain. Providing great protection without becoming cumbersome, the Heavy Carapace Helmet is now stronger and more durable without sacrificing comfort for protection. This was achieved through advancements in plasteel plating, providing greater protection without adding too much weight. Though lacking the larger stores of its lighter brethren, the Heavy Carapace Helmet has become more popular with heavy infantry and shocktrooper regiments throughout the Rim.\n\nThis variant is marked for usage by Officers.
li.vanillaDesc: A reinforced carapace helmet built to pair with heavy carapace armor. Extra plating provides greater protection at a cost of adding additional weight while remaining resource-efficient. Identical to the standard heavy carapace helmet, but decorated with gold inlay to denote officer rank.

ThingDef.label: Heavy Carapace Helmet (Faceshield)
ThingDef.description: The greatest battle after the fall of the Great Domain was the seven battles of Deirdre, the last of the Coreworlds to fall. For over 200 years, the planet of Deirdre was assaulted by the Insectoid and Mechanoid forces which saw the once beautiful planet become a Deathworld. The Domain Honor Guard eventually falling into despair and reorganizing into the Company of Sorrows, determined to keep the planet free. This helmet is a testament to that, a reinforced faceshield to ensure that soldiers who often fought in both ranged and melee could be protected against all threats.

li.loreDesc: The greatest battle after the fall of the Great Domain was the seven battles of Deirdre, the last of the Coreworlds to fall. For over 200 years, the planet of Deirdre was assaulted by the Insectoid and Mechanoid forces which saw the once beautiful planet become a Deathworld. The Domain Honor Guard eventually falling into despair and reorganizing into the Company of Sorrows, determined to keep the planet free. This helmet is a testament to that, a reinforced faceshield to ensure that soldiers who often fought in both ranged and melee could be protected against all threats.
li.vanillaDesc: A reinforced carapace helmet built to pair with heavy carapace armor. Extra plating provides greater protection at a cost of adding additional weight while remaining resource-efficient. Equipped with a faceshield for additional facial protection but reduces sight for the wearer.
